snippet: Politicians often struggle to maintain the popularity that got them elected at home. But how do they fare abroad? A new poll suggests that European views of the Continent's top leaders can be colored by national interest, traditional enmities or just...
abstract: Politicians often struggle to maintain the popularity that got them elected at home. But how do they fare abroad? A new poll suggests that European views of the Continent's top leaders can be colored by national interest, traditional enmities or just plain ignorance.

headline.main: Europe Doesn't Like Sarkozy Either ... And Few Other Leaders
